item.title: Depth of Field
item.description: Depth of field # This describes the distance between the nearest and farthest objects in a scene that appear acceptably sharp in an image. The distance between the nearest and farthest objects that appear acceptably sharp in an image is called the depth of field. The depth of field is affected by the focal length of the lens, the aperture of the lens, and the distance between the subject and the camera.
